entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 8.11.25
entry.summary: State Representative Alek Skarlatos talks about the re-allocation of $35 million in funding for a State Veterans Home in Roseburg, and looks at the upcoming special session of the Oregon State Legislature

entry.title: ROSEBURG HAS HOTTEST DAY OF 2025 ON SUNDAY, BREAKS RECORD FOR THE DATE
entry.summary: August 11, 2025 4:00 a.m. Roseburg had the hottest day of 2025 so far on Sunday, and broke the record high temperature for the date. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 103 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The previous hottest...

entry.title: HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH 2:00 A.M. WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: August 11, 2025 3:50 a.m. A Heat Advisory remains in effect through 2:00 a.m. Wednesday for central Douglas County. entry.title: DOUGLAS DISTRICT NOW UNDER EXTERME PUBLIC USE RESTRICTION LEVEL

entry.title: CITY COUNCIL BEGINS MONDAY EVENING WITH SPECIAL MEETING
entry.summary: August 1, 2025 3:20 a.m. Roseburg City Council will begin Monday evening with a special meeting. Councilors will gather at 6:00 p.m. to hear a presentation from Anvil Northwest. No details regarding what will be covered were provided on the meeting agenda. At 7:00 p.m. the regular meeting will be held. Councilors will consider options...

entry.title: ODOT FOCUSING ON EXCAVATION WORK ON OREGON 42 IN GREEN
entry.summary: August 11, 2025 3:05 a.m. A contractor with the Oregon Department of Transportation is continuing work on a nearly $12 million long-term project on Oregon 42 between Winston and the Green District. entry.summary: August 11, 2025 2:50 a.m. Adapt Integrated Health Care, HIV Alliance and Douglas Public Health Network will host the county’s 3rd annual International Overdose Awareness Day event on Saturday, August 23rd. entry.title: DFPA WITH FINAL UPDATE FOR BURNT MOUNTAIN FIRE

entry.title: Fir Grove Park splash pad in Roseburg open until Labor Day for summer heat relief
entry.summary: ROSEBURG, Ore. - For those seeking respite from the forecasted summer heat, Roseburg's popular splash pad at Fir Grove Park remains open daily until Labor Day.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 8.8.25
entry.summary: The News Review Managing Editor Drew Winkelmaier talks about Friday’s print edition of the paper, including special coverage of the anniversary of the 1959 Roseburg Blast, which was on Thursday.

entry.title: The preacher and the teacher
entry.summary: Editor's note: This is an except from "The story of our years at St. George's as told by Father Alfred S. Tyson 1949-1978, and had been edited to feature only the information relevant to the Blast."

entry.title: Extreme Heat Watch for Sunday morning through Monday night
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — An Extreme Heat Watch is in effect for Sunday morning through late Monday night for parts of Southern Oregon.

entry.title: Remembering the 1959 Roseburg blast
entry.summary: Early Aug. 7, 1959, a red truck loaded with explosives erupted in downtown Roseburg, killing 14 people, injuring more than 120 and flattening entire blocks of the city’s core.

entry.title: Dock Dogs and more at the Douglas County Fair
entry.summary: The Douglas County Fair brought crowds in as Wednesday kicked off with animal shows, live music, typical fair food, vendors of all sort, carnival rides and so much more.

entry.title: Rodeo: Challenge of Champions Tour stops at Douglas County Fair
entry.summary: Levi Gray of Dairy has been riding bucking animals since he was 3 years old, he said Wednesday.

entry.title: Bicyclist struck and killed by vehicle in Douglas County crash
entry.summary: A 42-year-old California man died early Thursday morning after being struck by a vehicle on his bicycle on Interstate 5 near Sutherlin, according to the Oregon State Police.
